snippet: The Ford Crown Victoria, the greatest muscle car used by law enforcement, is racing toward retirement, with Trooper Randy Elkins assigned to drive the last one purchased by the Washington State Patrol.
abstract: Ford Crown Victoria is headed for retirement after more than decade as most widely used law enforcement vehicle in nation; vehicle went out of production in 2011, leaving many officers wistful; Trooper Randy Elkins has been assigned as driver and keeper of final Crown Victoria Police Interceptor that Washington State Patrol purchased.
lead_paragraph: The Ford Crown Victoria, the greatest muscle car used by law enforcement, is racing toward retirement, with Trooper Randy Elkins assigned to drive the last one purchased by the Washington State Patrol.

headline.main: Officers Are Wistful as Crown Vic, Long a Fleet Staple, Nears Retirement
headline.print_headline: Officers Are Wistful as Crown Vic, Long a Fleet Staple, Nears Retirement
